description: MENARID:  Institutional Strengthening and Coherence for Integrated Natural Resources Management

subproject.description:
1.1. Monitoring and information system for land use change, land and water and ecosystem degradation assessment
1.2. Documented analysis and results of the economic, non- monetary and trade-off costs of the degradation within watersheds and landscapes at demonstration sites
1.3. Inventory of best practices from research, farmer innovation, PTD and local knowledge  
1.4. Increased awareness at all levels from community to national stakeholders of the need for and benefits from integrated approaches to natural resource management
2.1. Community-based demand for INRM supported by coordination committees and planning across sectors
2.2. Evidence-based examples of new policies, laws and regulations for INRM
2.3. Demand for assessments of the degradation status of lands in watersheds, including specified ecosystems and land uses, along with trade-off between land uses and the impact of changing land use on other parts of the landscape
2.4. community driven demand for information on approaches and technologies that integrate best practice across watersheds and landscapes 
3.1. Quantitative calculations of global environmental benefits to be derived by integrated approaches to INRM in watershed and landscapes in Iran, and the impact that could be derived by up-scaling from the demonstration sites using cross-sectoral coordination
3.2. Implementation of land use and water management practices that are people-friendly, cost-effective and climate- resilient, that can also improve returns within the constraints of local agro ecological conditions
3.3. Payments for Environmental Services schemes are operative at the demonstration sites or nearby where financial benefits accrue to local land
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: MENARID
